item.title: NYT Connections Hints Today (#992)—Answers for Friday, February 27
item.content:encoded:
You’ve made it to the end of another week, and to celebrate, you should smash another NYT Connections puzzle. Below, you’ll find the NYT Connections hints, answers, and explanations you’ll need to cap off another busy week and coast into the weekend happy. Of course, that yields more NYT Connections puzzles… But that’s why I’m here!

How to Play NYT Connections

In June 2023, NYT Connections emerged as yet another game in the ever-growing lineup of the New York Times titles. This title soared immediately, and it’s easy to see why. As a free-to-play, accessible New York Times game, NYT Connections is available worldwide and can be played on desktop devices or in a mobile app.

But how do you play NYT Connections?

The NYT team will provide you with a grid of 16 words once a day. The only task left up to you is to sort those words into four groups of four by finding their commonalities. Every NYT Connections puzzle has just one solution, and some words can have double meanings, so it can sometimes be tricky to figure out the answers.

It’s also important to stress that the words are color-coded: yellow, blue, green, and purple. That’s in order of difficulty, from least to most.

What’s critical here is that you get four guesses every day, and if you use those, your NYT Connections answers for today will be out of reach, as it’ll be game over.

Today’s NYT Connections Hints (February 27)

Here are the words from today’s NYT Connections puzzle:

  • JUDAS
  • DRILL
  • QUALITY
  • BUTTERFLY
  • FRENCH
  • BENCH
  • AIR
  • RIPPLE
  • SNAKE
  • SNOWBALL
  • TRAITOR
  • MANNER
  • DOMINO
  • PRINTING
  • IMPRESSION
  • TURNCOAT

And here are the hints I can offer for today’s NYT Connections:

  • Yellow – Words associated with betrayal
  • Green – Words you’d associate with someone’s aura
  • Blue – Words you’d associate with chain reactions
  • Purple – Words you’d associate with different kinds of ‘press’

Here’s the final warning before we get to the NYT Connections answers for today, February 27:

Are you sure you want to scroll further?

Very well!

NYT Connections Answers Explained for Today, February 27 (#992)

If you want to jump straight to the answers for today’s NYT Connections puzzle, I’ve got you covered:

  • Yellow – JUDAS, SNAKE, TRAITOR, TURNCOAT
  • Green – AIR, IMPRESSION, MANNER, QUALITY
  • Blue – BUTTERFLY, DOMINO, RIPPLE, SNOWBALL
  • Purple – BENCH, DRILL, FRENCH, PRINTING

When Does NYT Connections Reset?

That’s today’s puzzle, but if you want the next one, the game resets daily at midnight local time (that’s your local time). You’ll have 24 hours to complete the puzzle when midnight ticks over in your timezone.

How did you do? Did you get a perfect run? Let me know what your streak looks like on the Insider Gaming Discord server

Written by

Senior Editor and Esports Lead

Grant's adoration for gaming started on the Amstrad CPC in 1996. Now, he's a multi-platform expert gamer with a deep love for the industry, a passion for esports, and more…

More from Grant Taylor-Hill

item.title: Resident Evil Requiem Will be the First to Use PS5 Pro’s Upgraded PSSR
item.content:encoded:
PS5 Pro has received an upgraded version of the PSSR, and it’s rolling out in the coming weeks, and Resident Evil Requiem will be the first to use it.

Resident Evil Requiem has finally released today and has already climbed the charts, becoming the series’ biggest Steam launch. The launch includes a special surprise for PS5 Pro users: they will be able to use an enhanced version of the console’s upscaling technology in the coming weeks.

PS5 Pro Update Will Come with a New ‘Enhance PSSR Image Quality’ Option

Revealed through the latest PlayStation blog post, PS5 Pro is getting upgraded PSSR (PlayStation Spectral Super Resolution) soon, with Resident Evil Requiem becoming the first game to use it. Capcom’s Masaru Ijuin has stated that the upgraded PSSR has allowed them to “elevate our expressiveness by successfully processing these details and textural particularities, which are traditionally difficult to upscale because of their intricacy.”

The report explains that the enhanced PSSR algorithm and neural network are derived from the Project Amethyst partnership with AMD. The upgraded version will provide the very latest of this co-developed technology. Multiple games will be able to access the improved PSSR in March 2026.

The post also stated that the PS5 Pro’s Upgraded PSSR will come with a software update that provides a new option in the settings called ‘Enhance PSSR Image Quality’. This tool will allow players to experience the improved PSSR in any compatible PS5 Pro game, and some titles will have “noticeably crisper graphics.”

In other news, Sony could be considering stopping the release of its single-player games on PC. Additionally, PlayStation Plus free monthly games for March 2026 have been officially revealed. What are your thoughts on PS5 Pro’s Upgraded PSSR coming to Resident Evil Requiem first? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Paramount seemingly defeating Netflix in the bidding war for Warner Bros. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Pokémon Presents February 2026—Everything Announced: 30th Anniversary Special
item.content:encoded:
It’s time to celebrate the 30th anniversary of arguably the biggest and most important media franchise in history. The February 2026 edition of Pokémon Presents celebrates 30 years of the brand, and this hub has everything announced.

Pokémon turns 30, and it’s both depressing to hear but heartwarming to feel. Many of you have grown up with Pokémon, being there since the very beginning. Old and new fans are getting to see what many of the years ahead have in store for us all through the Pokémon Presents February 2026 special.

Everything Announced At Pokémon Presents February 2026

Pokémon Red & Blue Soundtrack Game Boy System

A new mini-Game Boy with interchangeable cartridges for each song.

Pokémon World Championships 2026

A look at the upcoming World Championships, showing everything that will be there, as well as a look at special PokemonXP art.

Takes place August 28-30, 2026.

Pokémon Trading Card Game

A new set is arriving in 2026. It’s a classic Pokémon TCG set with reprints of old cards coming out later in 2026.

Pokémon GO 10th Anniversary

Many returning Pokémon are coming back to the game, and a new Pokémon GO Tour is running from February 28 to March 1.

Also, use prom code: “GOTOURKALOS” to encounter special Pokémon.

‘Red’ To Appear In Pokémon Masters EX

The OG protagonist of the first Pokémon games will be appearing in Pokémon Masters EX. Available following the conclusion of Pokémon Presents February 2026.

Check out the free-to-join Insider Gaming Discord Server? You can discuss all things Pokémon, gaming, and much more!

For more guides, check out the complete Pokémon Go Tour: Kalos Raid Schedule, and rumors on Pokémon coming to Fortnite.

item.title: Resident Evil Requiem Becomes Series’ Biggest Steam Launch
item.content:encoded:
Resident Evil Requiem has managed to cross the Steam peak player count of all other titles in the series on release day.

The long-awaited ninth instalment of the Resident Evil series has released today, and if you are wondering about purchasing the game, here’s a guide on the prices, game editions, and more. Capcom’s new title has launched with flying colours, leaving all previous titles in the dust.

Resident Evil Requiem Hits Record Player Peak Count on Steam

The Steam player-peak numbers for Resident Evil Requiem are now available on SteamDB, and it’s now sitting at the top spot in the franchise. At the time of writing, the title has peaked at 276,509 players, which is close to 100,000 more than the game in the second spot. Requiem is followed by Resident Evil 4 at 169,191, Resident Evil Village at 106,631, Resident Evil 2 at 74,227, and Resident Evil 3, reaching an all-time peak of 60,293 players.

Resident Evil Requiem takes players back to the devastated and haunting Raccoon City. This time, you will control two characters: Grace Ashcroft, an intelligence analyst for the FBI, and one of the franchise’s beloved icons, Leon S. Kennedy. The gameplay returns to the series’ classic survival-horror roots, featuring combat, investigation, puzzles, and resource management. You can switch between first-person and third-person perspectives as you confront all the horrors that await you.

In other news, an ex-Capcom director has stated that Resident Evil Requiem leakers “deserve a thousand deaths“. Additionally, here’s a guide to help you decide between the classic and modern difficulty settings. What are your thoughts on Resident Evil Requiem becoming the series’ biggest Steam launch? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about MLB The Show 26 adding a new Trade Hub to Franchise Mode. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Complete Pokémon Go Tour: Kalos Raid Schedule—Raid Dates & Start Times
item.content:encoded:
Pokémon Go Tour: Kalos is upon us and there is plenty to sink your teeth into during the two-day event, including a packed raid schedule.

Pokémon Go Tour: Kalos takes place from February 28, 2026, featuring new additions to the wild Pokémon, a slew of Research Tasks to complete, alongside various boosts to Shiny Pokémon odds.

To help you plan your raids for Pokémon Go Tour: Kalos, Insider Gaming has the full schedule.

All Pokémon Go Tour: Kalo Mega Raid Dates & Start Times

Pokémon Go Tour: Kalos has a packed raid schedule throughout the event, with new Pokémon appearing every hour between 10 AM and 6 PM on both days.

Both Mega Victreebell and Mega Malamar make their Pokémon Go debuts during the event, landing alongside a heap of other Mega Evolved Pokémon to challenge with other players.

  • More Insider Gaming: How to Get Link Charges in Pokémon Go

The table below shows all the Mega Raids available during Pokémon Go: Tour Kalos. All times listed are local time.

Pokémon Go: Tour Kalos One-Star & Five-Star Raids

Pokemon Go Tour: Kalos doesn’t just feature Raids with Mega Pokémon, as there are also other Pokémon to challenge

Special costume versions of Pikachu are making their debut at the event, both of which can appear as Shiny, alongside Honedge.

  • More Insider Gaming: All Pokémon Pokopia Pre-Order Bonuses & Prices

Check out all the one-star and five-star raids during the event below.

What are you plans fore Pokémon Go Tour: Kalos? Share your thoughts and plan events with other players in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Pokémon, find out the exact release date and start time for Pokopia, and read about the rumors of a Fortnite collab.
